channel.title: What do you do when...?
channel.description: Well I've been working hard on my server, and I'm getting everything done that I can, and want. But it's boring. What do you all do when you just generally get bored of programming. Java's rather boring for me to write code in, maybe it's because I don't know it fully, so I don't know it's tricks and gimmicks and what not. But what do you guys do?

item.title: What do you do when...?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:506908”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=625140.msg4256523#msg4256523 date=1362851176]
Have you considered building up a team?
[/quote]
I’ve got a person on my team.[/quote]
Maybe it is time to start dwelling into a multi-person team with assigned tasks and divisions?
Here are some positions I can think of:

[ul][li]Client developers[/li]
[li]Content developers[/li]
[li]Troubleshooting squad[/li]
[li]Website developers[/li]
[li]Community manager[/li]
[li]Etcetera etcetera[/li][/ul]

Having divisions can be quite beneficial for the reasons being communication, more brains and more brawn, a higher chance of success, and more ideas. With all of these playing into one project, ideas can be talked about and (probably) easier to achieve.
Just be sure that all of your developers are assured that the project will get somewhere, with honesty in mind, and motivation will be the key to success.
Also, you are always able to expand your knowledge with the many available Java docs and guides spread all through out the Internet.

Read full topic

item.title: What do you do when...?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

take a break.

the better you get in java the more fun it is. mainly because you can add whatever you want.

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

you start work in another language!

Try Erlang on for size!

item.title: What do you do when...?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Flame_:

Have you considered building up a team?

I’ve got a person on my team.

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:7, topic:506908”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=625140.msg4256522#msg4256522 date=1362851148]

Would a playing factor be that you are running out of ideas, or are you unable to stretch your limits any farther than you already have?

It’s not that I’m running out of ideas. It’s that I don’t know how to put the ideas I have into the game.
[/quote]

google[/quote]
My lack of skill isn’t the point of the thread.

Read full topic
